bibl.title: Letter from Lawrence [Walter L.] Reed to Philip Showalter Hench, October 8, 1940

div1.p: Reed informs Hench that he does not know the whereabouts of his father's notes, but he recommends several other avenues for investigation.

div1.head: Letter from Lawrence [Walter L.] Reed to Philip Showalter Hench, October 8, 1940
div1.opener:
2810 THIRTY - SIXTH PLACE N. W.
WASHINGTON, D. C.
Oct 8-40
My Dear Doctor Hench -
div1.p:
I delayed replying to your
letter of Oct. 1 - until I could see my
Mother (Mrs Walter) and my Sister (Mrs.
Blossom Reed) who live at Blue Ridge
Summit Pa (69 miles from Washington).

Neither Mother nor Sister know
where the original notes etc you
inquired about are. I have no positive
information on the subject but feel that
a letter to
The Surgeon General, War Dept.
Washington D.C. or
The Librarian, Army Medical Library
Army Medical Center - Washington D.C. or
to one of the following might help you
trace their whereabouts-

General A.E. Truby Retired
145 Laurel St.
San Francisco, Calif.

Colonel J. F. Siler Retired
3434 34 Place NW
Washington DC

General J.R. Kean Retired
2804 N. St. NW
Washington DC

General Merritte W. Ireland
1870 Wyo. Ave. NW
Washington DC
all of whom were close friends of my Father.

I request that your first letter
did not reach me and that I am not
able to be of more definate assistance
in the matter,
div1.closer: Sincerely- Walter L. Reed Maj. Genl. Retired
